text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires explaining that the DUP opposed the new Northern Ireland Protocol (and implicitly the preceding Irish Backstop) because it implied customs checks in the Irish Sea. The candidate answer states: 'This was a key demand of the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP), who had been boycotting the Northern Ireland Assembly over concerns about the Northern Ireland Protocol.' While it doesn't explicitly mention the 'Irish Backstop' or use the exact phrasing 'customs checks will have to be implemented in the Irish Sea,' the context provided (DUP boycott over concerns about the Protocol) directly addresses the core political opposition rooted in the perceived imposition of a border in the Irish Sea, which is the essence of the criterion's requirement regarding DUP opposition to the Protocol's implications.", "criterion_id": "7f2d4371-c1ef-4b44-81d6-c18c43964231"}
